Package game

Class ButtonFactory

java.lang.Object
game.ButtonFactory
public class ButtonFactory
extends java.lang.Object
Provides factory methods to create several kinds of buttons. Target classes (i.e., the classes that define the event handler methods) must be public. Event handler methods must be public and, unless otherwise noted, may not have arguments:
public void method() { . . . }

  • Method Details

    • makeImageButton

      public static javax.swing.JButton makeImageButton​(java.lang.String file, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes a button displaying an image and having a tool tip. The button is the same size as the image (unless stretched by the container).
      Parameters:
      file - the name of the file containing the image that will be placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      Returns:
      the initialized JButton instance.

    • makeImageButton

      public static javax.swing.JButton makeImageButton​(java.lang.String file, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target, boolean size)
      Makes a button displaying an image and having a tool tip. The size of the button is determined by the size parameter.
      Parameters:
      file - the name of the file containing the image that will be placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      size - true - size button to the image; false - do not resize button
      Returns:
      the initialized JButton instance.

    • makeImageButtonArray

      public static javax.swing.JButton[] makeImageButtonArray​(java.lang.String file, java.lang.Object target, boolean size)
      Makes an array of image buttons from a file containing a list of button features. Each button displays a label and has a tool tip.
      Parameters:
      file - the name of the file that contains the button descriptions. The file must have the following entries, one per line, for each button (blank or empty lines are ignored and my be used as button information separators):
      • Button label
      • Tool tip
      • Method name
      target - the object in which the event handler methods are defined.
      size - true - size button to the image; false - do not resize button
      Returns:
      an array of initialized JButton instances.

    • setSelectedIcon

      public static void setSelectedIcon​(javax.swing.JToggleButton button, java.lang.String file)
      Adds an icon that is displayed when the button is selected.
      Parameters:
      button - the button on which the icon will be added
      file - the image file containing the icon

    • makeLabelButton

      public static javax.swing.JButton makeLabelButton​(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes a button displaying a label and having a tool tip. The size of the button is determined by the label.
      Parameters:
      label - the button label.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      Returns:
      the initialized JButton instance.

    • makeLabelButtonArray

      public static javax.swing.JButton[] makeLabelButtonArray​(java.lang.String file, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes an array of labeled buttons from a file containing a list of button features. Each button displays a label and has a tool tip. The size of the button is determined by the label.
      Parameters:
      file - the name of the file that contains the button descriptions. The file must have the following enteries, one per line, for each button (blank or empty lines are ignored and my be used as button information separators):
      • Button label
      • Tool tip
      • Method name
      target - the object in which the event handler methods are defined.
      Returns:
      an array of initialized JButton instances.

    • configure

      public static void configure​(javax.swing.AbstractButton button, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Configures an existing button with a tool tip and adds it to a proxy event listener.
      Parameters:
      button - the button that will be configured.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.

    • addText

      public static void addText​(javax.swing.AbstractButton button, java.lang.String text)
      Adds a text label to an existing button. The label is centered below the button.
      Parameters:
      button - the button on which the text will be placed
      label - the string label appearing on the button.

    • makeImageToggleButton

      public static javax.swing.JToggleButton makeImageToggleButton​(java.lang.String file, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target, boolean size)
      Makes a toggle button displaying an image and having a tool tip. The size of the button is determined by the size parameter (see "size" below). The event handler method should have the following signature:
      public void method(Object button) { . . . }
      button is a reference to the button that generated the event (i.e., was pressed).
      Parameters:
      file - the name of the file containing the image that will be placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      size - true - size button to the image; false - do not resize button
      Returns:
      the initialized JButton instance.

    • makePlainButton

      public static javax.swing.JButton makePlainButton​(java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes an unlabeled button (having neither a label nor an icon) but having a tool tip. The event handler method must have the following signature:
      public void method(Object button) { . . . }
      button is a reference to the button that generated the event (i.e., was pressed).
      Parameters:
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      Returns:
      the initialized JButton instance.

    • makeRadioButton

      public static javax.swing.JRadioButton makeRadioButton​(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String tip, javax.swing.ButtonGroup group, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target, boolean selected)
      Makes a radio button displaying a label and having a tool tip; the button can be set as selected. The radio button is placed in button group provided by the caller. The event handler method must have the following signature:
      public void method(Object button) { . . . }
      where method is the name of the event handler method and button is a reference to the button that generated the event (i.e., was pressed).
      Parameters:
      label - the label placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      group - the button group to which this button will be added.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      selected - determines if this buttons is selected (i.e., checked) or not.
      Returns:
      the initialized JRadioButton instance.

    • makeRadioButton

      public static javax.swing.JRadioButton makeRadioButton​(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String tip, javax.swing.ButtonGroup group, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes a radio button displaying a label and having a tool tip; the button is not selected by default. The radio button is placed in button group provided by the caller. The event handler method must have the following signature:
      public void method(Object button) { . . . }
      where method is the name of the event handler method and button is a reference to the button that generated the event (i.e., was pressed).
      This method is equivalent to
      makeRadioButton(label, tip, group, method, false)
      Parameters:
      label - the label placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      group - the button group to which this button will be added.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      Returns:
      the initialized JRadioButton instance.

    • makeCheckBox

      public static javax.swing.JCheckBox makeCheckBox​(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String tip, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object target)
      Makes a check box displaying a label and having a tool tip. public void method(Object button) { . . . }
      button is a reference to the button that generated the event (i.e., was pressed).
      Parameters:
      label - the label placed on the button.
      tip - the tool tip text associated with the button.
      method - the name of the method called when the button is pressed (must be public).
      target - the object in which the event handler method (above) is defined.
      Returns:
      the initialized JCheckBox instance.
